intro: Centaurium rigualii, commonly known as the Sierra centaury, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Centaurium rigualii is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
